questions.question: Which term describes a stage in a process that slows down the entire workflow?
options: Redundancy
Bottleneck
ROI
Scalability

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence to describe a target completion.
options: By June, we will be finished the audit.
By June, we will have finished the audit.
By June, we will finishing the audit.
By June, we will have finishing the audit.

questions.question: What is the 'As-Is' model in workflow analysis?
options: The ideal future state of the process.
The current, existing state of the process.
A list of all employees in the department.
A financial report on company assets.

questions.question: If a process is 'scalable', it means it can:
options: Be deleted without consequences.
Handle an increase in workload effectively.
Only be done by one person.
Be automated immediately.

questions.question: Next month, our department ________ (implement) the new safety protocols. (Future Continuous)
What does 'to phase out' mean?
options: To start using something immediately.
To gradually stop using something.
To increase the price of a service.
To hire a new consultant.

questions.question: Which of these is an example of 'over-processing'?
options: Sending an email to a client.
Adding complex formatting to an internal memo that no one reads.
Automating a repetitive data entry task.
Reducing the number of required approvals.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'Once the upgrade is complete, we ________ our reliance on manual filing.'
options: will have reduced
will been reducing
will have reduce
will reducing

questions.question: The term 'value-add' refers to tasks that:
options: Cost the company the most money.
Are required by law but provide no benefit.
Directly benefit the customer or the end goal.
Are done outside of normal working hours.

questions.question: By the time the manager arrives, the team ________ (map out) the entire workflow. (Future Perfect)
